markdownRemark.html:
Mostly inspired by this gist. But I don't want base R, so below are just some key commands needed.

  1. Install key dependence
sudo apt install gdebi libxml2-dev libssl-dev libcurl4-openssl-dev libopenblas-dev
  1. Looks like Java, or maybe for PDF extraction tools as the author said
sudo apt install libpoppler-cpp-dev default-jre default-jdk r-cran-rjava
  1. TTF/OTF fonts usage
sudo apt install libfreetype6-dev
  1. For Cairo for graphic devices
sudo apt install libgtk2.0-dev libxt-dev libcairo2-dev
  1. For HTML webpage compile
sudo apt-get install texinfo
  1. For error neither inconsolata.sty nor zi4.sty found
sudo apt -y install texlive-latex-recommended texlive-pictures texlive-latex-extra
or
sudo apt-get install texlive-fonts-extra

Then, download latest version R from here. unzip and configure it as:

./configure --prefix=/home/tian/Software/install/R-4.1.2 --exec-prefix=/home/tian/Software/install/R-4.1.2

Then, check if all warning/error are addressed. Then make and make install.

frontmatter.title: Commands needed to install R on Ubuntu
frontmatter.abstract: It is always hard to install R in linux, in compile way... Here are some quick code I recorded to install R on Ubuntu system.
